column1: On [[15 November]] [[1961]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column6: articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien Collection: Other Tolkien Writings, 1911-1976

column1: *'''Subject:''' Discussion about the forthcoming ''[[The Adventures of Tom Bombadil]]'' (1962),<ref name=CG/>  as well as his former chair at Oxford: "I wasn't a professor of "Literature" - which I still think is not a good basis for academic study".<ref name=TB>{{webcite
*'''Publication:''' A description of the letter appeared in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column2: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''. Extracts from the letter were quoted in ''[[Christie's 20th Century Books and Manuscripts 2 December 2003]]''.

column1: *'''Archive:''' The letter is kept at the [[Marquette University]].<ref name=Marq/>
